intro: Hieracium guentheri-beckii subsp. ortisanum, commonly known as the ortisan hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads that produce yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
